turns.text: Are you a fan of Google or Microsoft?
Both are excellent technology they are helpful in many ways. For the security purpose both are super.
I'm not a huge fan of Google, but I use it a lot because I have to. I think they are a monopoly in some sense.
Google provides online related services and products, which includes online ads, search engine and cloud computing.
Yeah, their services are good. I'm just not a fan of intrusive they can be on our personal lives.
Google is leading the alphabet subsidiary and will continue to be the Umbrella company for Alphabet internet interest.
Did you know Google had hundreds of live goats to cut the grass in the past?
It is very interesting. Google provide "Chrome OS" which is a light weight OS. Google provided a lot of hardware mainly in 2010 to 2015.
I like Google Chrome. Do you use it as well for your browser?
Yes.Google is the biggest search engine and Google service figure out top 100 website, including Youtube and Blogger.
By the way, do you like Fish?
Yes. They form a sister group of tourniquets- they make the sea water clean and remove the dust from it. Fish is the biggest part in the eco-system.
Did you know that a seahorse is the only fish to have a neck?
Freshwater fish only drink water through the skin via Osmosis, Saltwater fish drink water through the mouth. Dolphins are friendly to human beings.
Interesting, they also have gills. Did you know that jellyfish are immortal?
Yes. Fish is the important resources of human world wide for the commercial and subsistence fish hunts the fish in the wild fisheries.
What about cats, do you like cats? I'm a dog fan myself.
The cat is referred as domestic cat and wild cat. They make our world very clean from rats!
Yeah, cats can be cool, but they sure do spend a lot of their time sleeping.
Cats hear the sounds too faint or too high frequency human ears can hear.
I heard that too. Well, it was nice chatting with you. Have a good day.
do you like dance?
Yes I do. Did you know Bruce Lee was a cha cha dancer?
Yes he even won a hardcore cha cha championship in 1958
Yeah. Did you know Tupac was a ballet dancer?
Yes and he even was in the production of the nutcracker
Yeah. Ballet dancer go through 4 pairs of shoes a week
Yes that is a lot of shoes and also a lot of money
Yeah true. Did you know babies are really good at dancing?
Yes and they smile more when they hit the beat
Yeah they are much smarter than we give them credit for
True Did you know Jackson had a patent on a dancing device?
Yes it helped him smooth out his dance moves
Nice. Do you like Shakespeare?
Yes I do. Do you know that he popularized many phrases
Yes like good riddance, in my heart of hearts and such
Yes and then he also invented names like Jessica, Olivia and Miranda
Yes. And for his works you have to use old english for it to make sense
Yes otherwise the rhymes and puns do not seem to work out
Yes. He lived at the same time as Pocahontas too
I wonder if they met how that would go from there
Yeah interesting point. Nice chat
I think its sad to have to part with a pet due to allergies and couple conflict like in the Dear Amy section.
That is sad. Do you have pets? The first cloned pet was a cat and its name was copy cat.

Yes, I have a dog. Sounds like in the Dear Amy that they do everything tit for tat. The cat owner states that her fiance has to get rid of his saltwater fish if she gets rid of her cat. That's not necessarily fair though I don't think. They seem like they may struggle as a couple in the future.
Yeah that's a bit dramatic! A cat lover is known as an ailurophile and a dog lover is known as a cynophile.
Allergies can be serious to people. I understand his reserve of having a cat.
Me too. A pet or companion animal is an animal kept primarily for a person's company, protection, or entertainment. No one should have to be made uncomfortable by a pet in the house.
I'm sure she loves the pet, but she has to make a choice if the pet is harming her fiance.
Over 1.5 million living animal species have been described. I'm sure they can find one to agree on.
Did you ever hear that animals develop white patches on their foreheads when they are domesticated? That's a new one to me.
That's interesting! Of the 1.5 million species, 1 million are insects! Yuck!
Apparently, there is a breed of jellyfish that is immortal. If you want to live forever, you can look into being a jellyfish.
Fascinating! In japan, there are more pets than there are children under 15.
Teddy Roosevelt had over 20 pets and his own real "teddy" bear along with a hyena
Wow! There are more tigers living as pets in the us than living wild in asia.
I never met anyone with a tiger pet. That is strange. It's not legal to own pets in Boulder, Colorado but you can be their guardian.
Lots of places have special animal rights. In 2002, germany became the first country in the world to universally give animals constitutionally-guaranteed legal rights.
The loch ness monster is protected by 1912 Scottish provisions
That's funny. It's not even a proven species. There are about 20 quintillion individual animals on planet earth.
Did you ever hear of people being contacted due to DNA matches? You can opt in or out but might be connected with matches of family members
That is pretty cool. There are several companies offering DNA testing, and each seems to offer a different way of handling client privacy
DNA matches could be connected via social media.
hi, do you like fish?
Yes, I love fish do you?
yes me too. some of them can eat prey twice their sizew
Yes, did you know seahorses only fish to have a neck?
that is so cool, and the males carry the young in that species
Yes, and zebrafish are very interesting.
yeah did you know we use them to figure out stufffor ourselves
Yes interesting, How about the first cloned cat named copy cat?
that is cool. there is a jellyfish that is immortal
I know, really? How about our hiccups are from gills and lungs?
that is a such a cool fact, we are still evolving so maybe it will eventually go away
lol, interesting to know the loch ness monster is a protected species.
yet no one has really seen it to confirm its existence
I know, Also, I do believe in Japan there is less people under 15 years of age than pets.
do you know how many idnividual animals are believed to be on earth?
Yes, 20 quintillion, can you believe that?Wow
I do not even know how many zeros are in that number
lol, I know, I guess the US have more tigers as pets than living wild in Asia.
and Roosevelet did not have any of them
He did have a bear and hyena. Good to know you are a guardian not an owner in Colorado to pets.
I like that too. nice chat
Hello
Hello. do you have a cat? I see that some people can be allergic to them.
No, I do not. I am actually allergic to cats. The first cloned pet was a cat and its name was copy cat
That's interesting and a little funny. I had no idea of this, but the cat is the most popular pet in the world. DId you know that?
Wow, no I didn't know that. There are more tigers living as pets in the us than living wild in asia.
Now that I had no idea of. Did you know that some tarantulas keep frogs as pets?
Wow, that's odd. Two of the most popular pets are dogs and cats
I have dogs and used to have cats too but dogs are my favorite.
Dogs are my favorite also. I hope to get another one in the future.
Do you have any now? I have two.
No, I do not. What kind do you have? 84 per cent of genes known to be associated with human diseases have counterparts in the zebrafish
I have a beagle and a border collie. I had no idea about that with the zebrafish. I wonder if cures can be found by using their genes.
I used to have a collie named Bimbo. That's a great question.
Mine is named Cute Stuff. Did you know about the fish that lives on land? I wonder what it is.
No, I didn't. There is a breed of jellyfish that is immortal
Seriously? I thought they just evaporated in the sun?
Absolutely, There are about 20 quintillion individual animals on planet earth.
And who knows how many that are undiscovered. Animals are truly fascinating!
Yes, they are. In 2002, germany became the first country in the world to universally give animals constitutionally-guaranteed legal rights.
I think that is a good thing! I like how the netherlands is constructing wildlife bridges.
Me too. Thanks for the informative chat.
Hello, Did you know that there are over 1.5 million living animal species?
No, that was chock full of interesting facts. Hiccups are residual from when we had gills and lungs? Interesting stuff.
Never heard that one before, lol! There is a fish called the black swallower that is capable of eating prey twice its length and 10 times its own weight.
I knew one of those in my fraternity in college I think. I was shocked to learn there is a breed of jellyfish that is immortal. Only creature on earth that can claim that here on the planet.
Yeah we all know that guy! how about the loch ness monster being protected under the Scottish 1912 protection of animals act. Creatures of the great deep are extraordinary. "The immortal Jelly fish.
I already looked up that jellyfish on my phone. Fascinating, yes loch ness is protected and pets in Boulder, Colorado are not owned, but guarded. Interesting how different cultures handle that.
Tell me about it apparently there are more U.S. Tigers living as pets than there are living in the wild in Asia.
Yes, that is sad in some ways too. Happy we're keeping them alive, probably in zoo but going extinct in the wild is a sad statement on the planet today.
I agree. Germany became the first country to universally give animals constitutionally-guaranteed rights.
While I'm a pet owner, that going a bit far. Do you give dogs and cats rights, how about those dairy cows or cattle to be eaten. Do they get lesser rights?

Very good point. My wife and I are watching Blue Planet. It's shocking some of the things that are down in the deep. they are still making discoveries every single day. Apparently the sea horse is the only fish with a neck.
Yes, and really they say we know more about the face of the moon than the bottom of the ocean. Who knows what's down there we don't know? Maybe the Loch Ness monster's cousin.
If you ever get a chance you should check this show, there's some amazing creatures down there. 84% of genes that are associated with diseases have counterparts in the Zebrafish.
I read that and thought the same. I wonder how similar the Zebra Fish is to humans? Can we use that in medical research?
If we can i'm sure it will be preventative or medication. There's no money in cures. I didn't realize that we had already cloned a cat and named it Copy Cat, that's too funny.

Yes, the scientist in that experiment had a sense of humor. Related to domestication, I had no idea that domesticated animals develop a white patch on their foreheads. I wonder what causes that, it doesn't seem to have any evolutionary reason to me.
Sounds strange. I can't fathom why anyone would want a rat for a pet. I'm a little leery of guinea pigs and ferrets. anything with red eyes you can keep.
Haha, yep. A snake doesn't seem very warm or comforting either. I don't understand why people enjoy having them as pets. And how do they find partners who accept it?
Other people who like that stuff i guess, haha. Apparently Theodore Roosevelt had 20 pets including a bear and Hyena. I wonder if he played with them much?
Well, President of the United States, I wonder if he had them in the White House? Did he have a stable for the bear out back?
Some animals just should be domesticated. That white patch if true is something to ponder.
Yes indeed, interesting facts that will give me pause this weekend. That was an enjoyable conversation. Thanks and have a lovely weekend.
You as well!!
Thanks.
hey hows it going, do you know what the first cloned animal was?
Was it a sheep? I heard the first cloned pet was a cat, though. Its name was copy cat. That is funny!
haha ya I like that, what is also wild to me is that there are more domesticated tigers living as pets than there are wild tigers living around asia
Wow, that is weird and sad. Speaking of which, did you hear about the tiger found in the duffel bag?
no that is really sad, poor tiger what happened to it? Why was it in a bag?
I guess it was being smuggled to the USA from Mexico.
ya I don't like that that makes me mad, do you have any pets? I guess In Japan there are more pets than there are kids under the age of fifteen
They really love their pets huh? No, I don't have any pets. Do you?
no we used to have a dog but we were only watching her for a bit and the owner took her away, we had lots of pets as kids though like iguanas and rabbits and such
In Boulder, Colorado you cannot own a pet. You can be their guardian though.
hmm that seems dumb like its just playing with words, do you like Teddy Roosevelt? apparently he had over 20 pets, or as they say in Colorado, "Guardians" haha

Maybe it helps people to feel more of an obligation to their pets. Shrug. Yeah, Teddy Roosevelt is an interesting guy. It's unfortunate though that people try to domesticate tigers as you mentioned. Many of the animals perish along the way from suffocation or hunger.
ya that makes me really sad, what do you think about fish? I had salmon for dinner so I do think theyre tasty haha
Haha. Funny. I don't eat seafood. My mom forced me to eat salmon way too often when I was little and I grew sick of it. Haha #firstworldproblems.
haha ya, well I am like the black swallower fish, I could eat a salmon twice my height and ten times my weight because I love it
Funny. I would love to learn more about a jellyfish that is immortal.
I know they need to apply those genes to me! also weird is there is no fish except for the seahorse that has an actual neck
So seahorses are salt water right? I guess they drink water though their mouths while freshwater fish only drink through their skin.
yes that would be true, also true is that 84% of human disease genes are also associated with the zebrafish, we need to study that fish too!
How odd! Do you think the loch ness monster is real? It is a protected species!
haha I wish it were real! that's funny they did that in 1912, maybe they knew something that we dont?
What would you do if you found a baby tiger inside of a duffel bag?
I would look around to make sure Mama tiger is not in the area and looking at me with, "Gimme back my child" look!
LOL yep you don't want to be around an angry tiger mom haha. I guess they found one on the southern Border in Texas, a bag with a baby tiger that is
Was it a smuggling thing?
Yes I think so unfortunately. the smuggling industry is a billion dollar trade unfortunately
With 20 quintillion animals in this world, why would anyone feel the need to smuggle one?
Haha well different animals are definitely worth different amounts, I don't think a mosquito is worth anything LOL. Why do you think animals can get white patches on their foreheads?
Once domesticated, animals develop white patches on their foreheads, likely because once indoors, they run into painted walls and doors with their heads. I know i do.
Haha I wonder if humans developed these white patches as well. What do you think about Germany giving constitutional rights to animals? They did that back in 2002
I think German constitutional right for animals are pretty cool. Pretty, pretty . I learned about that while watching the German remake of the classic film, "12 angry hamsters"
Well I'll have to watch that movie. I just think it's cool that hiccups are relics of When Animals had both lungs and gills, so next time you have the hiccups think about that LOL

Does that mean putting a bag over your head while hiccupping may cause you to de-evolve? Maybe that is what happened to the Loch Ness Monster! I'm glad she is a protected species. Hate to think someone might bag Aunt Matilda.
It's funny that it's protected by 1912 Scottish law, the "protection of animals act". hopefully that means that it's a real animal LOL but I doubt it
Yeah. Aunt Matilda would make a better hag fish anyway, or maybe a seahorse, since they are the only fish with a neck.
That is crazy! I also think it's crazy that there is a jellyfish breed that can never die AKA its immortal

Does that mean they never get cancer, or they get cancer forever? You know, 84% of genes associated with human disease are also found in the zebrafish, but I have never seen a zebrafish with MS or Parkinson's disease.
Haha I haven't seen it either! Maybe some people have the black swallower fish disease, because black swallow fish Can Eat Prey twice their length and 10 times their weight haha
Haha. If freshwater fish can drink through it's skin, why don't you ever see a freshwater fish floating in a margarita?
Haha I wish I could drink through my skin and float in a margarita LOL. Do you have any pets by the way?
Too many to count. We've had Hamsters, snakes, scorpions, lizards, fish, cats, dogs, chickens, birds.Our apartment is getting cramped.
Haha that's a lot of animals! We have a dog actually, but I can't believe that there are more pet tigers in the USA than Wild Ones in Asia, a lot of people must have illegal pets here
Can you recommend any movies to watch?
Do you like Star Wars ? The movie about Hans Solo just came out on Netflix.
Is that the one where its about a young Han Solo?
Yeah it is the one, so Han Solo is not played by Harrison Ford, does it affect your opinion of the movie ?
Someone else can fill Harrison Fords shoes? Maybe ill check into how well this Alden guy does in the role
He did a good job, but Han Solo was already young in the 1977 movie, I think it impacted negatively the movie.
Does Chewbacca appear in this movie?
Yes it does, but it is not the same actor who did the other movies. I don't think that matters too much.
I like their relationshop in the movies. Chewy is a very loyal friend
In the canon Chewy has a family a wife and 2 sons.
Thats interesting. I heard George RR Martin had an illustration that Chewie is based off of
I heard that too, it was on the cover of one of his small stories. It is a peculiar creature when you think about it.
I wonder what other crazy creatures we could have had in space with Martins help. There's a giant fictional Universe that could be filled.
Would you like to see a film with Chewbacca as the principal character ?
I think it would be interesting. There are also so many comic stories that could be told. I just wonder how communication would work in such a movie
They would use subtitles. And good storytelling, like how Hans Solo seems to understand Chewie's intentions, but not his words.
Yeah its like having a dog as a best friend. But able to shoot things
There was also a dog movie that opened this summer A.X.L. about a robot dog.
I will have to check that one out as well. Thanks for your time. have a good day
Do you like dogs ? I love them, they were one of the first domesticated animals.
Yes! dogs and elephants can understand pointing
Good Morning! How are you today?
Well, you may be on the other side of the fence but I like neither Kanye nor Trump.
I couldn't have said it any better lol. That was such an odd meeting between them two a couple months ago!
I recall the time that Kanye stood up to a President when he perceived racism, now he seems to have flipped. I guess they money makes a big difference,
A very big difference. He even thinks AIDS is a man-made disease!
People love a good conspiracy story. I think that is how Trump does so well, people believe in the Deep State, and such.
I agree! What kind of music do you like to listen to?
I'm a kid of the eighties and nineties, I never really moved on from that alternative rock scene.
Same here! I think rap has been a major significance in the last twenty years though huh?
There has been the odd rap song that I like, but for me it's cultural. I'm just not from the environment most rappers are and can't appreciate their point of view.
I agree too! I can't believe a michigan judge once delivered her ruling to eminem in the form of a rap haha.
That's kind of cool, I like it when people don't take themselves too seriously. Like when Kanye made fun of himself on SNL. If only he'd do it more.

All he has to do is talk and it happens haha. I give him props though, he once gave his mic to a fan in a wheelchair at a concert. However, I'm sure he told a person to stand up in a wheelchair before too.
Funny. Are you one for hats? Probably not a MAGA hat, but hat's in general?
I wear hats when I'm out hiking, but that is about it, how about you?
Generally not. I'm originally from the UK so I guess most people would associate me with a bowler hat, but never really worn any type of hat.
It took me awhile to figure out what it looks like but now I know. Wasn't that the most popular hat in the old west too?
I'm guessing that is because of TV and movies, we get this idea of the way it is shown when reality is somewhat different. Being self deprecating, I'd say a dunces cap suits me well.
Well said! I think it suits me well too haha. That is where the conical party hat was derived from!
Or maybe we could give it to Mr West next time he wants to speak his mind to us.
Or just when he is walking around being the odd self he is. Anyways, I had a great chat with you, have an awesome day!
Do you like wearing hats? It has so many functions!
I don't like them on myself but I know a lot of people that can pull them off.
Yes me as well. In the military hats denote a nationality, branch of service, rank or regiment.
I noticed the different hats in the military but did not know it had to do with rank.
Yes they have a function to play. In the old west, the most popular hat was the bowler!
Wow! They always show a stetson or something close so I'm shocked by that.
Yes me as well! Tipping of ones hat arises from the knights raising their face visors. Very chivalry of them!
That's a very interesting fact. Did you know that until 1998 British politicians were required to wear a top hat if they were making a point of order?
Oh wow that seems kind of an old tradition. Kind of like that conical party hat which was derived from dunce caps!
That's also a strange hat. As far as old traditions in British politics I don't understand why they still wear powdered wigs in court either. So strange.
Agreed. They look so silly in my opinion. A lot of rapping attire looks silly too. But the rapper Tupac was very talented as his music is in the library of congress of cultural significance.
I'm surprised they would include any rap at this point to be honest. Speaking of rap, do you know what Eminem wanted to be before he was a rapper?
I didn't know that. Very interesting. Rappers also have some odd beliefs. Like Kanye West who thinks AIDS is a man-made disease.
Eminem actually wanted to be a comic book artist. Kanye West is very strange and has a lot of strange ideas.
Yes he is. But he has done some good things like giving a mic to a fan in a wheelchair at his concert.
That was nice of him. Did you know that Busta Rhymes did voice work in an animated movie?
Oh yeah you're right. He was the Reptar Wagon in the 1998 Rugrats Movie!
Yes he was. He has a distinct voice so I don't know how I missed it initially.
Good point. I didn't know rap was popular in Korea. They created a form of rap dueling called compliment battle! Well thanks for talking with me today!
I didn't know that either. That has to sound a lot different than the rap battles here. It was nice talking with you as well.
Yes here they are much more agressive! Have a good one!
did you see that Kanye is having another kid?
I heard something but I'm not really following his offspring :)
I saw that they are using a surrogate and only paying 70k. I'd want a whole lot more than that!
ok, yes that's what I read. and somebody needs to explain to me, how using a surrogate really works.
Simple explanation: They take egg from mom, Sperm from dad - put it together and then into another person.
ok. why are they doing that ? Kardashian can't have babies ?
Not sure to be honest, I'd love to know too though.
I think it's just another thing to do to be on the cover of the magazine and have plenty of interviews. this is a crazy world.
I wouldn't doubt it. Speaking of him, do you like rap music? (trying to cover the topics! haha)
lol ;) no, not really. I don't consider it to be music ;)
I mean - I think it is definitely music.but I agree not my type.
Doesn't music needs melody ? ;)
Lots of rap does have that!
a sample on keyboard doesn't count ;)
I'm thinking you haven't heard much more than whats on the radio then
Maybe You're right, I don't want to argue ;) not my cup of tea though :) I'm more of a blues fan. Classic rock, maybe metal. ;)
I'll pretty much listen to anything except country. It is god awful
I don't listen to country but I don't mind it. It has it's own charm and it takes skills to play and sing country.
I suppose. Just like most music what is played on the radio is just garbage
I agree. I mean I haven't heard anything new that's good. Maybe except Black Country Communion. great band
Can't say I know them!
Hey what's up do use Google very often?I really love the company and was surprised to hear that it was founded back in 1998.
i think everyone must use it daily! its become ingrained in every day life
Agreed. The Google headquarters in Mountain View California is nicknamed the Google Plex.
thats funny. The current CEO is Sundar Pichai, i didnt know Larry Page was replaced
Oh yeah I didn't know that either. I also want to go to google Plex to see the goats who mow their lawn by eating it.
say what now?? they have that??
Yeah apparently lol! They do that instead of hiring people to mow!
thats both funny and i guess imaginative. leave it to a huge tech company to employ actual goats!
Yeah exactly I am sure they are cheaper. One thing I bet they couldn't exploit is fish. I think fish are so cool there is actually a breed of jellyfish that is immortal.
i had rememered hearing about that before. Immortatlity is wasted on a jellyfish haha. did you know a seahorse is the only fish that has an actual neck?
That is so funny I guess I never considered a seahorse a fish. The black swallower fish sounds a lot like a snake because it can eat pray that is so large.
i guess they live up to their name then!
It seems they do. I also didn't know that there was a difference with how freshwater and saltwater fish drink.
thats crazy. i wonder why fresh water ones only use osmosis?
Yeah and saltwater fish are lucky because they can do that and drink through their mouth's.
seems like fresh water fish got the short end of the stick with that one. Have you ever been to a cat cafe?
I have never been to a cat cafe no, what about you? Seems like they are popular in Japan and Taiwan.
no but I would love to! paying hourly to hang out with adorable cats? im in!
Yeah that would be a lot of fun. I didn't realize that cats sleep so much. Must be nice.
i guess thats where the phrase "cat nap" comes from
Oh yeah I guess so ha ha. There's even a town in Alaska that has a mayor cat.
Do you like rap music?
I do, but I cannot tolerate Kanye West. I adore Tupac, and think it's interesting that the Library of Congress chose his music to be included because it's culturally significant.
I agree, Kanye's old music was really good. He's just out there. Just like how he thinks AIDS is a man-made disease.
I just don't care for him. I would have loved to have been in the courtroom, the day a judge decided to give her ruling to Eminem, in rap style.
That would have been funny. Speaking of Eminem, did you know that his true dream was to become a comic book artist?
Yes, Spidey is his favorite. My brother used to love Rugrats when he was little, I only found out recently, that Busta Rhymes voiced the reptar wagon in the movie.
I didn't know that either. That's pretty interesting. Did you know that Korean rappers invented a new type of freestyle?
The compliment battle, lol. i would love to hear that. I love how people think the cowboy hat was the most popular in the old west, yet it was really the bowler.
Yeah, cowboy hats were more as working hats weren't they? Did you know that up until 1998 politicians had to wear a top hat if making a point of order in the House of Commons?
I did not. That sounds interesting. Much like the "tip of the hat" originates from Knights raising their visors.
That is interesting too. I heard that in 1908 a law was passed limiting the length of hatpins.
They did that, so they wouldn't be used as weapons. Smart move.
Yeah it is. I'd hate to be stabbed to death with a hat pin.
That does sound like a painful way to die. I do like the fact that Kanye gave his mic to a fan in a wheelchair once. He does have a few redeeming qualities.
Yeah he does have a few. He once did an SNL skit mocking for interrupting awards shows.2 years before the infamous Taylor Swift incident.
I have no idea what that is, as I don't pay attention to her either. I still find it mindblowing that Big Sean turned down a scholarship to Michigan, to go rap.
Yeah that is pretty good. He made a good choice I guess, he's one of the biggest rappers in the world right now. He can always go back.
Big Sean is? Weird, most have never heard of him. I do like Kanye's middle name, Omari,.
So his initials are K.O.W. That's funny!
I love the skits Saturday Night Live does of trump. The one of Brett Kavanaugh was hilarious, have you seen it?
Yes it was hilarious!
Thank you for chatting with me, have a nice day.
I enjoyed it, I hope you have a nice day as well.
Hello. Did you know that there is a candy desk in the us senate?
haha yeah, I heard about that. It's been there since 1968.
I guess they all like candy a lot! At least it's american made. The candy is made in pennsylvania.
What candy is made in Pennsylvania besides Hershey?
They've got milky way bars, mars bars, and even jelly beans!
Wow, that's way cooler than the fact that they didn't let women wear pants until 1993.
I know. It is so surprising to me that it took that long for two women senators to protest by wearing pants on the senate floor.
They wore pantsuits, they kept it classy. haha.
Yes they did. Senate is very big on tradition. They used the same gavel for 165 years until it got cracked.
Senate can be so cool, haha. Did you hear that in 1988 they arrested senators to force them to vote? I thought that sort of things only happened on House of Cards
I have heard about that. One of the senators tried to escape and was carried feet first into the senate chamber by three officers!
Yeah, I think that rule might be from before senators were elected. They weren't elected until 1913.
Elections are a good and a bad thing. I've heard somewhere that the people of Ancient Athens came to the conclusion that elections would lead to an oligarchy.
I think that might be because nobody votes. Voter turn out hasn't gone higher than 62% in 100 years.
Maybe some people figure there's no need to vote. Research shows that the taller candidate wins most of the time anyway.
We should just have people voted in by lottery. That's what Athens used to do.
It almost seems as if that is what we have now. I think more states than just Nevada show have a none of these candidates on their ballots.
Yeah, hopefully we'll see some electoral reform soon, hopefully we can see this will improve fairness.
Speaking of fairness did you know that not all men in the UK could vote until 1918?
nope. But, I did hear that astronauts can vote from space.
That is amazing and very determined. It's like India setting up a booth just so one person can vote in a forest that is full of lions!
Hi are you a fan of Star Wars?
My son is, so I know a little bit about it.
